page.title: 08Diet
page.content: Most people have{three meals per {day:-breakfast,lunch and supper.These meals are taken in the{early morning, {noon and evening respectively.These meals may be supplemented by coffee and biscuits at about 11.00,and cake, sandwiches and tea at 4.00 p.m. {Breakfast}usually consists of either cereal and toast or the more traditional morning fry up(fried egg, bacon and sausage)with orange juice, tea or coffee. For the working population{lunch provides the major break of the day and is taken sometime between{12.00- {2.00.This meal can range from}a sandwich to something very much more substantial.Large lunches are especially common on Sundays and often serve as the main meal of that day, usually consisting of{roast lamb,beef {or pork and a variety of vegetables.
